name: Iberostar Cozumel

reviews.title: No assistance offered
reviews.text: On the third day of my vacation, I slipped and feel on the wet stamped concrete sidewalk. I broke my foot, although at the time I did not know it was broken. The resort staff offered no medical attention (due to my old age of 54). They refused to drive me (in their shuttle) to the hospital. The only assistance they offered was the use of a wheelchair. I spoke with the General Manager of this property and he offered nothing. I spoke with another guest who had slipped on the marble floor and broke her arm. Her experience was similar to mine. Great place as long as you maintain your health! For the record, I was sober when I fell . . . 7:00 AM on my way to coffee.

We booked the Iberostar with two other couples. The bus from the airport was ready when our flight arrived, check in was quick and easy. Staff was friendly and helpful in trying to get us settled as quickly as possible.
reviews.title: What a great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent with many choices and varieties at each meal. The only thing we would have wished for was a seafood night featuring perhaps lobster and grilled shrimp. All of the bathrooms around the hotel were always clean.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!

likes.liked: — Staff, beautiful grounds, wildlife, free drinks in rooms in mini-fridge

reviews.text: We booked the steakhouse for an a la carte meal and it was excellent. It would easily compete with one of our steakhouses in quality.
reviews.title: great value

reviews.text: The beach was terrific. Of course, the usual early parade of people with their towels trying to get that perfect spot early in the morning. Despite signs indicating not to do that. But it's funny to watch.
reviews.title: Got Married And Loved It!

reviews.text: Of the several resorts I've visited, Iberostar Cozumel compares to none. Even of the several Iberostar's....this is my favorite. Separate bungalows, jungle setting, southern point of the island, secluded, beautiful beach, Albertos is a walk away down the beach, staff, food....Was there in August, going back this month. Can't wait to get back!!
reviews.title: Going back....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were invited to Cozumel for a wedding. Having never stayed in the area before, we did not really know what to expect.
reviews.title: Had a great time!

reviews.text: The only really disappointment we encountered was the beach, or lack there of. Cozumel is a diver's paradise. The entire island is a coral reef and lacks sandy beaches with the exception of a couple on the East side.
reviews.title: I'll never go back there

reviews.text: This resort was incredible. We loved how the rooms are laid out. Small round buildings with no more that four rooms in each. The rooms are small, but clean and fresh linens each day if you so desire. The small refrigerator was stocked each day with coke and water and beer.
reviews.title: A fantastic holiday vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good. It is mostly buffet, but still hot and delicious. You can reserve meals at the restaurants a couple of times, based on how long you stay. These meals are great and should not be missed.
reviews.title: Great Value if you pay the right price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed from Jan 4 thru 11. I'll start by saying I am a fan of the Iberostar Resorts. We have stayed at the Quetzal in Playa Del Carmen , Paraiso Beach and at the Bavaro in in the Dominican Republic before this stay.
reviews.title: Anniversary Trip

reviews.text: The good news : This resort as all of the others is well maintained and
reviews.title: Great week in Cozumel at Iberostar

reviews.text: very clean. The food is average but we always could find something interesting at the buffet. Would not recomend the other restaraunts unless you just prefer to have reservations. Breakfast was the best meal by far . Thanks to Nicole for the omelet and the smile each morning !
reviews.title: Iberostar Cozumel, Best Place On The Island

reviews.text: Stayed in building 88 on the second floor. The room was nice but small. Did not have any water or plumbing issues as other reviews spoke of. Nice shower ,lots of hot water !
reviews.title: got stomach flu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not much room for storage in the room if you travel with a lot. The rooms and resort are rustic . My wife says it reminds her of the Smurf village.
reviews.title: Cheers to you!

reviews.text: I'd like to thank the staff who wrks so very hard and gives the greatest service and such great food and diving experience. I wish I were a millionare so I could compensate you justly. Many staff are there in the evening an back the next morning!!!! The spareribs I had at the steak house were the best ever. Angel gave professinal 5 star service. We are only together (our family ) once r twice per year. We had a carefree wonderful time. It was warm but the rooms were nice and cool when wanted. Vanessa, Francisco, and Isabelle at he diveshop were so wonderful always making sur we had a wonderful experience. The turtles were fantastic. I can't say enough. The people working on the grounds are very artistic. The only criticim I have is please respect the bartenders. They need screens or something to protect them from the bees. Thanks again to everyone who works so hard. Hope to see you next year.
reviews.title: Thanks for a wonderful relaxing vacation great staff!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place feels like a real real value for the money. The grounds are so beautiful and well-maintained, and the bungalows, painted in pleasant Carribbean colors, feel both private and part of a friendly community (the staff is super nice). The AC worked well, and we thought the beds were very comfortable (we prefer a firm mattress). This was our first all-inclusive vacation, and our only complaint was that it was difficult to not overdo it with the food, which was plentiful and available throughout the day. There was a nice variety of fresh vegetables, fruit, and the fish was fabulous. They cooked paella on the beach one day, which was yummy and fun! As others have mentioned, the beach is rocky, so water shoes are really helpful. The beach had plenty of lounge chairs, palm trees and palapas for shade, and the pool is lovely. If you care about aesthetics, you'll appreciate this place. We walked down the beach one day to the neighboring Occidental Grand, and were amazaed at how icky the beach/pool area there was. Overall--the Iberostar was fabulous. We only wished we'd booked for a few more days!
reviews.title: Book for a week!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. This is the fifth AI that my wife and I have stayed in and my only complaint about the hotel is the horrible drinks. Fruit juices were non-existent and alcoholic drinks were weak and pathetic. But the staff was outstanding.....friendly and helpful and patient. The resort was clean and the food was what one would expect at an AI. I would gladly go back again.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, rude guests

reviews.text: When we arrived on August 4th, the hotel was about 80% filled with fat, drunken hillbillies from Texas. Picture Homer Simpson as a redneck. They were loud and obnoxious and rude, yet the staff never had an attitude or complained. On Sunday the 8th, about 3/4 of them left and by Tuesday the 10th, they seemed to all be gone. At that point the resort became a wonderful place to be. We met terrific guests from PA, Ohio, IN, CO and elsewhere and had a wonderful time for the last 3 days. It was restful and beautiful and a vacation paradise.
reviews.title: A laid back relaxing resort-great for the price!!!

reviews.text: The hotel cannot be blamed for the rudeness and ignorance of its guests; we just picked an unfortunate time to be there. But if you are looking for a clean, comfortable all-inclusive hotel with a wonderful staff and snorkeling and scuba diving at your disposal, this is a great choice.
reviews.title: We Had A Great Time

reviews.text: When I made my reservation I told them that I walked with a 4-wheeled rollator. In other words, I don't walk on my own. I wanted the beach and beautiful water that I could get to. That's why I chose Cozumel. However, if that is what you are interested in don't stay here. When I arrived, I noticed that the swimming pool was very crowded. Once I got to the beach, I realizd why the pool had so many people - there were massive boulders of coral on the waters' edge and into the water. There was no way a person, especially a physically handicapped person, could get into the water easily.
reviews.title: If it is the beach you want - don't stay here

reviews.text: I was told not to worry about not being able to get into the water. The people at the resort told me I could go out on a snorkle trip each day to get my water fix in. That was going to eliminiate laying around on the beach (which there wasn't too much of because of the boulders anyway) but was also going to cost an additional $40 for each snorkle trip.
reviews.title: Only good thing was The Dive Shop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needless to say, rather than ruin my vacation, I moved to another hotel that had a beautiful beach and everyone could get into the water without water shoes and getting marred up from coral.
reviews.title: Divers paradise

reviews.text: Dive shop amazing. Dives, amazing.
reviews.title: Lovely Vacation - despite food poisoning
New Years 2012/13
reviews.text: Rooms dated. Hair drier did not work, phone did not work, my daughters room phone did not work, air conditioning did not work (couldn't turn it off).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Iberostar Cozumel from the 11th of January to the 18th. The resort was occupied at about 50% so it was very quiet, the place is clean, the grounds beautiful with lots of plants, flowers and palm trees. The pool is quite big and warm enough. The pool bar is great with Nicolas as our preferred bartender. We ate at 2 a la carte restaurants, the steakhouse and the star rock cafe, both were very good. The buffets were also excellent with lots of choice and fresh fruits and vegetables. The drinks are also excellent. The rooms are not very big but very comfortable once you get a mattress toppper which we got by writing an email in advance. You have a mini fridge in the room which is filled regurlarly and the maid did an excellent job at keeping our room clean. This hotel is not new but kept in rather good shape, maybe the A/C unit was a bit noisy, but not that big of a deal.Check in was a breeze as was check out. The beach, as other reviewers have said, is not very nice to swim since you need shoes to get in and out. This hotel is paradise for divers since you have a dive shop on the premises (Dressel Divers, see my review for them). It is absolutely wonderful to walk out of your room with your wet suit on and your vest on your shoulder, walk on the boat and the tanks and weights are already there, nothing to carry basically. The staff is quite friendly contrary to other reviews I have read, not to offend anyone, but maybe if you give a little tip here and there to those people who are working hard for not a whole lot, to make your stay enjoyable will help them put on a smile. We also rented a Jeep from Less Pay rentals to tour the island. We paid $50 for the day insurance included, they picked us up at the hotel, we went in San Miguel to fill out the paper work and we were on our way. They also drove me back to the hotel the next day when I returned the Jeep. We went to Sin Martin beach which is absolutely amazing with huge waves. We later proceeded to a nearby restaurant, Coconuts bar and grill, this place is amazing. You sit on a lookout that resembles the ruins at Tulum and the view is fabulous, so was the food and drinks. Overall this was a great vacation for us and I would return anytime.
reviews.title: Nice vacation at Cozumel

reviews.text: We've stayed at this Iberostar on 2 occasions and had a perfect time. Well maintained grounds and friendly staff. Most speak atleast some English to go with our ever growing Spanish so no probs there, in fact, it gets quite fun as they enjoy learing words from us as we learn theirs. We'vs stayed at Iberostars in other locals too and all have been top notch. Be sure and bring long pants for dinning in the specialty restaurants! (Burmuda shorts don't count)
reviews.title: Iberostar Resorts = BEST

reviews.text: If you're looking for a fun, reasonably-priced resort, Iberostar Cozumel is a great one. The best thing about it were the people. The employees are so friendly and accommodating. They make you feel special. The free-roaming peacocks, flamingos, iguanas, and cats (they even have an on-site vet to care for all the animals) were wonderful. Tons of food. I'm vegetarian and I never went hungry. The pool was awesome and I enjoyed the upbeat water aerobics. We also too advantage of the snorkeling trip which was only $45. I saw lots of starfish, sand dollars, a shark, sea turtle, stingray, many tropical fish, beautiful sea vegetation and coral. The beach was rocky so if you're looking for a white, sandy beach - this isn't the place for you. I didn't miss it though. It's easy to take a cab to town and go shopping. One night vendors from town came in with tables of silver jewelry and there was also an artist who did amazing paintings using spray paint. Like I said, prices are very reasonable so the rooms aren't brand new and mine smelled a bit musty the first day but once the a/c was on, the smell went away. I had a blast.
reviews.title: Had a great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We read lots of reviews of Iberostar Cozumel. Excellent customer service. Beautiful grounds.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, but....

reviews.text: Upon entering our room, we smelled the humidity. Experienced that at other resorts in the Carribbean. Expected it. Went for the buffet that night. Thought the chef was doing leftovers night. Very dissappointed. This went on for a few days. We then witnessed the General manager and assistant manager coaching the chef on his food. Quality went up 100%. Disappointed we were restricted to 4 a la carte reservations in a 14 day stay.
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation!

reviews.text: Maybe not *zero* stars, but certainly not more than three. Upon walking to our room for our recent one week vacation, we observed a man stomp out of one of the icemaker alcoves, shouting, “Does anything in this damn place work?” Not an auspicious start for our vacation. And there’s quite a list of things that don’t work. Here’s what does: The Star Friends, who are relentlessly upbeat, despite the heat and indifferent guests, especially Pedro; the groundskeepers, as the place looks well-manicured 24/7; the wait staff at the buffet who do their best in ridiculous heat, especially the muy charming Adi. What doesn’t work falls into some general categories and, while lazing at the pool, it’s easy to compare other guests’ list of complaints to your own – and you won’t be doing this with a cold drink in your hand unless you get up and get it yourself, as only one very harried barmaid works the both beach and pool areas, where dirty glasses and plates are in piles. The showers can’t hold a temperature and frequently scald? Check, everyone says that. Something didn’t work in your room? Also check (for us, the safe didn’t work). Not getting minibar refills as promised? Yep. We were told every-other-day refills when we checked in. I complained at the desk on the second day and was haughtily informed that I had calculated the days incorrectly. Hmmm…Saturday arrival, Monday is the second day, right? I was assured that it would be refilled on Tuesday…nope. Finally, on Wednesday, I left a note for the maid in Spanish pleading that it was our fourth day with no refills and we were rewarded with 2 beers. And yes, we tipped the maids 500 pesos daily. The food is fine, but it is monotonously similar day after day. Sometimes, we recognized the previous night’s dinner food at the lunch buffet – that wouldn’t seem safe in the heat, but none of us got sick. The dining areas are not air conditioned and, in the case of the Steakhouse, the area we were seated in had broken fans – just another thing that didn’t work. We couldn’t even finish our food due to the combination of oven-like heat and relentless sand fleas. [Hot Tip: OFF apparently doesn’t slow down sand fleas, wear DEET to a Steakhouse dinner.] The drinks are so weak that I frequently could detect no difference between my daughter’s virgin daiquiris and my own “real” drink despite tipping the bartenders as instructed on Trip Advisor. [Next Hot Tip: Franklin and Rita at the beach bar pour the strongest drinks.] I think the thing that made us the most disappointed is that the Iberostar promo literature says it is such a great place for kids. Small kids, probably; Lucy’s Club seemed interesting for the young set, maybe age 7 or under. Teenagers would be fine with the expansive grounds and activities like archery and volleyball, which are for ages 14 and older (although you don’t know the age cutoff until you arrive at the activity and leave with your disappointed tween). My 9-year-old and 11-year-old were clearly too old for the cutesy stuff at Lucy’s Club (despite Iberostar’s stated age range) and too young to roam the labyrinthine grounds on their own. Hence the “I-zero-star” from my son. Passing a set of complaining parents at Lucy’s Club on my way to the pool, I overheard a Star Friend tell them, “It’s a resort for divers, it’s not really for kids.” Well, gee, how ‘bout putting that in the promo literature?
reviews.title: My son called it the I-ZERO-star...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, we paid an astonishingly small amount of money to stay here and we certainly got no more than we paid for. But we could have, say, taken a cruise, for the same amount – even paying for alcohol - and had better food variety, better activities for kids, better entertainment. So, caveat emptor on the “I-ZERO-star.”
reviews.title: GREAT HOLIDAY WOULD LOVE TO RETURN

reviews.text: We had a very good stay at this hotel, the staff were very efficient, rooms very clean. At first I was a little dissapointed with the restaurant as it smaller than previous hotels, this however turned out better as food was fresher and was not kept on the side but repelished regulary We had a lovely meal at one of the ala carte restaurants on our anniversary and the staff made it a special night. The grounds were well kept and it was great to see the wild live moving around.The taster sessions of facials and other beauty treatments were good and the daily stretch sessions with the massages at the end were great.
reviews.title: Mostly ... Disappointing

reviews.text: We would love to go back but the UK flights do not fly direct which means we would have to fly to Mexico and then take the ferry.
reviews.title: Servicio

reviews.text: Entertainment the same as any Caribean hotel.
reviews.title: Iberostar --you ARE a Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When my husband and I booked the Iberostar Cozumel I was confident we would have a great 7-day trip, and everyone at the Iberostar -- from the front desk and bartenders to the friends 'Star Friends' delivered!
reviews.title: Excellent Service, Excellent Stay
Enjoyed the Iberostar!
reviews.text: My husband, 35, and I, 30, were looking to go on a romantic trip to the Caribbean but we weren't sure where we should go. I had been to Cancun and Puerto Vallarta before and he had been to Mazatlan and Cozumel. He always had stayed at a hotel where food and drink were not included, and I had always stayed at an all-inclusive resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After nine months of marriage (and six years of dating) we decided to compromise. We'd go to Cozumel, but we'd do it all-inclusive style.
reviews.title: Beware of the glass bottom boat tour

reviews.text: First Impressions
reviews.title: Three Generations Enjoyed Iberostar

likes.liked: — The staff and the proximity to beach/dive sites.

reviews.text: The hotel is one of the most southern hotels on the island, so the bus trip from the airport took 15 to 20 minutes -- whizzing past people on scooters with inches to spare. The island still is pretty torn up from Hurricane Wilma, which wreaked havoc on the island in 2004, but the island still held its beauty. By the time we arrived at the gates of the Iberostar, I knew we were in for a treat.
reviews.title: No Palace But A Fine Place to Stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Iberostar during an extended family trip in March. The place was quite comfortable and we thought it was a good value, though not as nice as the Iberostars we had stayed at in Playa de Carmen. Some of the small issues were things that we expected from comments from others: the rocks when you went in the water along the beach (bring boating shoes), and the mildew smell in the ground floor rooms of some of the huts. For the latter, a wet towel on the drain helped and when we switched rooms to upstairs there were no more problems. The grounds are well kept with peacocks and lizards, and flamingos around.
reviews.title: Comfortable but not stellar (esp. kids' program)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful--my son wanted to eat a coconut from a tree, and the towel lady called the groundskeeper, who came and spent about 1 hour cutting coconuts open for all the kids (who showed up when they saw what was going on) to try. We found the food to be satisfactory. No one in our party had the least pick of sickness and there were lots of options, though we did see a bit more repetition in the menus than at some other places.
reviews.title: NOT Happy at this Iberostar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The children's program was not nearly as nice as the other Iberostars we had attended (which were also more expensive). They opened rather late in the AM, closed for a few hours for lunch (or the kids had to go to watch them practice their evening show, which our kids didn't really enjoy), and then closed again early PM. It created a schedule that was hard to work around if parents wanted to do activities (go into town, dive). Our kids are 7 and 10 and maybe they were too old, but the activities weren't too engaging for them. The kids' program staff seemed pretty low energy--not nearly as good as staff we've had at other places. But the kids did loved the pool and meeting other kids.
reviews.title: Mixed bag

reviews.text: For diving, I read a lot of contradictory reports on Dressel. They were taking boats out several times a day with boatloads of divers at a time. I found it cheaper to go with a dive shop that is locally owned from in town that I had used before (several years ago, prior to being certified). It is called Studio Blue. They have shops in Cozumel and on the mainland (Playa, I think) and have been in business for a number of years and seem quite safety conscious and reliable. It seemed that most of their divers were repeat business who had dived with them before, and, while I dont' dive a lot, I dived with DMs from overseas who were very pleased with them. Their boats are a little slower than some other shops, but you get personal attention (6 divers on the boat), and they charge about $75 for two tanks with gear rental included. No one that I dived with (I dived for several days) had any problems with gear that they rented. The drawback is that if they pick you up at the dock at the resort, they are charged a fee by the resort, so it's best if you have transportation to town. We found renting a car to be fun anyway, since this resort is kinda remote and it allowed us to tour the island and go into town for a couple afternoons. I would recommend Studio Blue for anyone looking for alternative to Dressel or looking for something a little less expensive than Dressel. I will definitely dive with them when I'm back in town again.
reviews.title: Great for the price

reviews.text: This resort isn't perfect, but only real disappointment for us was the kids program. We had a good time and would be likely to recommend it to others (with those few caveats).
reviews.title: just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Iberostar from Feb 3-10/08.
reviews.title: Pure Heaven

likes.liked: — We loved the groups and ambience of the the whole resort.

reviews.text: We were married in Cuba 3 years ago so we decided to celebrate our anniversary and go to Mexico to try a different resort and country.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: We checked in after 6 p.m. so upon arrival it was dark. We quickly checked in and were driven by golf cart to our 2nd floor room with a King size bed as requested.
reviews.title: Wouldn't go here again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so amazed at the grounds when we woke up on our first morning. So beautiful and lush...very tropical. It was just so nice to be there and not in Ontario with all the cold weather. I loved waking up every morning and walking to breakfast on the grounds of the Iberostar. Each morning was an aha' moment!
reviews.title: Our Iberostar Stay
You get what you pay for
reviews.text: Our very reliable and sweet travel agent Marion was bang on for knowing what we like in a resort. (Marion is the best girl who also made all my arrangements for my wedding in Cuba). Marion is the owner of Elgin Travel in St.Thomas Ontario Canada. Marion told us that the beach was okay but we wouldn't be able to swim because of the coral reef. That was fine because the pool was ample enough for us to lounge by and we did for 5 out of the 7 days. The pool area was great too. There was a swim up bar that divided the pool into two sides. This was nice because while the water aerobics and games were done on one side that left the other for casual swimming.
Just Returned from 7 night Stay - September 25th-Oct 2nd
reviews.title: Travel Agent - Just Returned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am giving this resort a very solid 4 star rating. No Glitz and Glam
reviews.title: Very Quiet

reviews.text: just beautiful location, and great staff.
reviews.title: great place perfect holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Resort was extremely empty - just the time of year - about 30% occupancy
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: The staff was wonderful and friendly. The resort is the furthest from town, so please be aware. Taxi is $20 each way into town if needed. No stores around other than resort gift shop. The Main Buffett is closed for remodeling, but due to low occupancy-not an issue.
reviews.title: Another GREAT time was had by all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I along with three others came here for the second time in October to get married on the beach. Our trip was amazing. The wedding was beautiful, I was treated like a queen by the staff all day. Annabelle the wedding planner was so easy to work with and well organized. The photographer was great and everywhere I looked there was someone taking care of us. The wedding was October 13th and we stayed for 4 days prior to our day. It rained the whole time we were there but it did not make a difference. It was a warm rain, your in Mexico get in the water. Food and drinks were great, wedding cake was the best we ever tasted ( strawberry). The beds are a little hard but we did not come to Mexico to sleep in the beds, (have an extra drink before bed and you will be fine). Some of the bad reviews on here seem to be people who will never be satisfied. If you are accustomed to 5 star then don't stay here because you will never find any guests that you could relate to. This is a laid back resort for people who don't mind walking to the bar to get there own drink when the staff is busy. Oh yeah, the entertainment crew is the best. I had Alex walk me down the aisle(beach). It's mexico so just like everywhere else there are bugs, don't leave any kind of sugar on the counters in your room aka drinks, toothpaste ect. little bugs will come. If you remove the problem and wipe off the counter with water no big deal.
reviews.title: Breathtaking wedding, Awesome vacation

reviews.text: We stayed 7 days at the Iberostar Cozumel from Nov. 12-19th 2007. This review is a little late. We enjoyed the resort and the time of year we were there. Everything was tropical and beautiful. We were a group of 7 in 2 families. Ages from 77 to 4 years old. The resort was only a 20 minute ride from the airport and is situated right on the beach. The beach is nice but beware that there is really a lot of coral and rocks right off of the beach into the water and the best way to do any swimming or wading in the water is to us the ladder off of the end of the jetty but still, there are a lot of jagged rocks.
reviews.title: Pretty good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Either the resort was not real busy this time of year or just about everyone there was diving all day because there were always plenty of loungers and chairs at the pool all day everyday. The pool was a bit too cool to really enjoy being in, even though it was very warm and sunny every day. We found the service at the pool bar and beach bar great and even though they use the cheaper bands of alcohol to mix the drinks, you can ask for and will receive the better brands. What difference does it make though when you mix them in all the fruity concoctions they come up with. If you don't think your drink has enough alcohol, just tell them to make it a double. They will and after you've done it a couple times, they remember.
reviews.title: Best place to celebrate an anniversary

likes.liked: — The employee staff is the best
likes.disliked: — We liked everything about the hotel

reviews.title: Another Good Value
reviews.text: The food at the buffets is where we found the most dissapointment. We all found them repiticious and mediocre at best. Not much selection for the dinner service. Can't say we tried the specialty restaurants. Asked several other guests and they didn't seem to impressed with them either. Breakfast and lunch were good but the same everyday. I will say none of us got sick and we didn't go hungry. We did walk about 50 yards North down the beach one night and had a great meal at Alberto's. It was a little pricey but very good food.

We went into the town, San Miguel one day. It is a $20 taxi ride each way. Lots to shop around for and some good restaurants there. The cruise ships own the town and it was elbow to elbow crowds all over the day we went.
reviews.title: Overall nice resort

description: Directly on the beach, in a rocky, coral–filled cove with unspoilt waters. A paradise for diving and snorkelling. Sub-tropical mangrove forest. Bungalows in typical local style. Second-largest reef in the World.
